äº‘è®¡ç®—

äº‘è®¡ç®—ï¼ˆè‹±è¯­ï¼šcloud computingï¼‰ï¼Œä¹Ÿè¢«æ„è¯‘ä¸ºç½‘ç»œè®¡ç®—ï¼Œæ˜¯ä¸€ç§åŸºäºäº’è”ç½‘çš„è®¡ç®—æ–¹å¼ï¼Œé€šè¿‡è¿™ç§æ–¹å¼ï¼Œå…±äº«çš„è½¯ç¡¬ä»¶èµ„æºå’Œä¿¡æ¯å¯ä»¥æŒ‰éœ€æ±‚æä¾›ç»™è®¡ç®—æœºå„ç§ç»ˆç«¯å’Œå…¶ä»–è®¾å¤‡ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨æœåŠ¡å•†æä¾›çš„ç”µè„‘åŸºå»ºä½œè®¡ç®—å’Œèµ„æºã€‚

äº‘è®¡ç®—æ˜¯æŒ‡åœ¨äº‘ä¸­è¿è¡Œå·¥ä½œè´Ÿè½½ï¼Œè€Œäº‘æ˜¯ä¸€ç§èƒ½å¤ŸæŠ½è±¡ã€æ±‡é›†å’Œå…±äº«æ•´ä¸ªç½‘ç»œä¸­çš„å¯æ‰©å±•èµ„æºçš„ IT ç¯å¢ƒã€‚äº‘è®¡ç®—å’Œäº‘æœ¬èº«éƒ½ä¸å±äºæŠ€æœ¯çš„èŒƒç•´ã€‚

  • äº‘è®¡ç®—æ˜¯æŒ‡åœ¨äº‘ä¸­è¿è¡Œå·¥ä½œè´Ÿè½½çš„åŠŸèƒ½ã€‚

BFF

æœåŠ¡äºå‰ç«¯çš„åç«¯ï¼ˆè‹±è¯­ï¼šBackend-For-Frontendï¼Œç¼©å†™ï¼šBFFï¼‰ æœ¬è´¨ä¸Šæ˜¯ API ç½‘å…³æ¨¡å¼çš„ä¸€ä¸ªå˜ä½“ã€‚å®ƒè¿˜åœ¨å¾®æœåŠ¡å’Œå®¢æˆ·ç«¯ä¹‹é—´æä¾›äº†ä¸€ä¸ªé™„åŠ å±‚ã€‚ä½†å®ƒä¸æ˜¯å•ä¸ªå…¥å£ç‚¹ï¼Œè€Œæ˜¯ä¸ºæ¯ä¸ªå®¢æˆ·ç«¯å¼•å…¥äº†å¤šä¸ªç½‘å…³ã€‚ ä½¿ç”¨ BFFï¼Œæ‚¨å¯ä»¥æ·»åŠ é’ˆå¯¹æ¯ä¸ªå®¢æˆ·ç«¯çš„éœ€æ±‚é‡èº«å®šåˆ¶çš„ APIï¼Œä»è€Œæ¶ˆé™¤å› å°†æ‰€æœ‰å†…å®¹é›†ä¸­åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªåœ°æ–¹è€Œå¯¼è‡´çš„å¤§é‡è‡ƒè‚¿ã€‚

SaaS

è½¯ä»¶å³æœåŠ¡ï¼ˆè‹±è¯­ï¼šSoftware as a Serviceï¼Œç¼©å†™ï¼šSaaSï¼Œå‘éŸ³ï¼šsÃ¦sæˆ–sÉ‘sï¼‰ï¼Œäº¦å¯ç§°ä¸ºâ€œæŒ‰éœ€å³ç”¨è½¯ä»¶â€ï¼ˆå³â€œä¸€ç»è¦æ±‚ï¼Œå³å¯ä½¿ç”¨â€ï¼‰ï¼Œå®ƒæ˜¯ä¸€ç§è½¯ä»¶äº¤ä»˜æ¨¡å¼ã€‚åœ¨è¿™ç§äº¤ä»˜æ¨¡å¼ä¸­ï¼Œè½¯ä»¶ä»…éœ€é€šè¿‡ç½‘ç»œï¼Œä¸é¡»ç»è¿‡ä¼ ç»Ÿçš„å®‰è£…æ­¥éª¤å³å¯ä½¿ç”¨ï¼Œè½¯ä»¶åŠå…¶ç›¸å…³çš„æ•°æ®é›†ä¸­æ‰˜ç®¡äºäº‘ç«¯æœåŠ¡ã€‚ç”¨æˆ·é€šå¸¸ä½¿ç”¨ç²¾ç®€å®¢æˆ·ç«¯ï¼Œä¸€èˆ¬å³ç»ç”±ç½‘é¡µæµè§ˆå™¨æ¥è®¿é—®ã€è®¿é—®è½¯ä»¶å³æœåŠ¡ã€‚SaaS æœ€å¤§çš„ç‰¹è‰²åœ¨äºè½¯ä»¶æœ¬èº«å¹¶æ²¡æœ‰è¢«ä¸‹è½½åˆ°ç”¨æˆ·çš„ç¡¬ç›˜ï¼Œè€Œæ˜¯å­˜å‚¨åœ¨æä¾›å•†çš„äº‘ç«¯æˆ–è€…æœåŠ¡å™¨ã€‚å¯¹æ¯”ä¼ ç»Ÿè½¯ä»¶éœ€è¦èŠ±é’±è´­ä¹°ï¼Œä¸‹è½½ã€‚è½¯ä»¶å³æœåŠ¡åªéœ€è¦ç”¨æˆ·ç§Ÿç”¨è½¯ä»¶ï¼Œåœ¨çº¿ä½¿ç”¨ï¼Œä¸ä½†å¤§å¤§å‡å°‘äº†ç”¨æˆ·è´­ä¹°é£é™©, ä¹Ÿæ— éœ€ä¸‹è½½è½¯ä»¶æœ¬èº«ï¼Œæ— è®¾å¤‡è¦æ±‚çš„é™åˆ¶ã€‚

IaaS

åŸºç¡€è®¾æ–½å³æœåŠ¡ï¼ˆè‹±è¯­ï¼šInfrastructure as a Serviceï¼Œç®€ç§°IaaSï¼‰æ˜¯æä¾›æ¶ˆè´¹è€…å¤„ç†ã€å‚¨å­˜ã€ç½‘ç»œä»¥åŠå„ç§åŸºç¡€è¿ç®—èµ„æºï¼Œä»¥éƒ¨ç½²ä¸æ‰§è¡Œæ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿæˆ–åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºç­‰å„ç§è½¯ä»¶ã€‚

IaaS æ˜¯äº‘æœåŠ¡çš„æœ€åº•å±‚ï¼Œä¸»è¦æä¾›ä¸€äº›åŸºç¡€èµ„æºã€‚å®ƒä¸ PaaS çš„åŒºåˆ«æ˜¯ï¼Œç”¨æˆ·éœ€è¦è‡ªå·±æ§åˆ¶åº•å±‚ï¼Œå®ç°åŸºç¡€è®¾æ–½çš„ä½¿ç”¨é€»è¾‘ã€‚ å®¢æˆ·ç«¯æ— é¡»è´­ä¹°æœåŠ¡å™¨ã€è½¯ä»¶ç­‰ç½‘ç»œè®¾å¤‡ï¼Œå³å¯ä»»æ„éƒ¨ç½²å’Œè¿è¡Œå¤„ç†ã€å­˜å‚¨ã€ç½‘ç»œå’Œå…¶å®ƒåŸºæœ¬çš„è®¡ç®—èµ„æºï¼Œä¸èƒ½æ§ç®¡æˆ–æ§åˆ¶åº•å±‚çš„åŸºç¡€è®¾æ–½ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å¯ä»¥æ§åˆ¶æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿã€å‚¨å­˜è£…ç½®ã€å·²éƒ¨ç½²çš„åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºï¼Œæœ‰æ—¶ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥æœ‰é™åº¦åœ°æ§åˆ¶ç‰¹å®šçš„ç½‘ç»œå…ƒä»¶ï¼Œåƒæ˜¯ä¸»æœºç«¯é˜²ç«å¢™ã€‚

PaaS

å¹³å°å³æœåŠ¡ï¼ˆè‹±è¯­ï¼šplatform as a serviceï¼Œç¼©å†™ï¼šPaaSï¼‰æ˜¯ä¸€ç§äº‘è®¡ç®—æœåŠ¡ï¼Œæä¾›è¿ç®—å¹³å°ä¸è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆæœåŠ¡ã€‚åœ¨äº‘è®¡ç®—çš„å…¸å‹å±‚çº§ä¸­ï¼ŒPaaSå±‚ä»‹äºè½¯ä»¶å³æœåŠ¡ä¸åŸºç¡€è®¾æ–½å³æœåŠ¡ä¹‹é—´ã€‚

PaaSæä¾›ç”¨æˆ·å°†äº‘ç«¯åŸºç¡€è®¾æ–½éƒ¨ç½²ä¸åˆ›å»ºè‡³å®¢æˆ·ç«¯ï¼Œæˆ–è€…å€Ÿæ­¤è·å¾—ä½¿ç”¨ç¼–ç¨‹è¯­è¨€ã€ç¨‹åºåº“ä¸æœåŠ¡ã€‚ç”¨æˆ·ä¸éœ€è¦ç®¡ç†ä¸æ§åˆ¶äº‘ç«¯åŸºç¡€è®¾æ–½ï¼ˆåŒ…å«ç½‘ç»œã€æœåŠ¡å™¨ã€æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿæˆ–å­˜å‚¨ï¼‰ï¼Œä½†éœ€è¦æ§åˆ¶ä¸Šå±‚çš„åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºéƒ¨ç½²ä¸åº”ç”¨æ‰˜ç®¡çš„ç¯å¢ƒã€‚

PaaSå°†è½¯ä»¶ç ”å‘çš„å¹³å°åšä¸ºä¸€ç§æœåŠ¡ï¼Œä»¥è½¯ä»¶å³æœåŠ¡ï¼ˆSaaSï¼‰æ¨¡å¼äº¤ä»˜ç»™ç”¨æˆ·ã€‚å› æ­¤ï¼ŒPaaSä¹Ÿæ˜¯SaaSæ¨¡å¼çš„ä¸€ç§åº”ç”¨ã€‚ä½†æ˜¯ï¼ŒPaaSçš„å‡ºç°å¯ä»¥åŠ å¿«SaaSçš„å‘å±•ï¼Œå°¤å…¶æ˜¯åŠ å¿«SaaSåº”ç”¨çš„å¼€å‘é€Ÿåº¦ã€‚

PaaS æä¾›è½¯ä»¶éƒ¨ç½²å¹³å°ï¼ˆruntimeï¼‰ï¼ŒæŠ½è±¡æ‰äº†ç¡¬ä»¶å’Œæ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿç»†èŠ‚ï¼Œå¯ä»¥æ— ç¼åœ°æ‰©å±•ï¼ˆscalingï¼‰ã€‚å¼€å‘è€…åªéœ€è¦å…³æ³¨è‡ªå·±çš„ä¸šåŠ¡é€»è¾‘ï¼Œä¸éœ€è¦å…³æ³¨åº•å±‚ã€‚

BaaS

åç«¯å³æœåŠ¡ (BaaS) ä½¿å¼€å‘äººå‘˜å¯ä»¥ä¸“æ³¨äºåº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºçš„å‰ç«¯ï¼Œæ— éœ€æ„å»ºæˆ–ç»´æŠ¤åç«¯æœåŠ¡å³å¯åˆ©ç”¨ã€‚BaaS å’Œæ— æœåŠ¡å™¨è®¡ç®—æœ‰ä¸€äº›ç›¸ä¼¼ä¹‹å¤„ï¼Œè®¸å¤šæä¾›å•†éƒ½æä¾›ä¸¤è€…ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯ä¸¤ç§æ¨¡å‹æœ‰ä¸€äº›å·®å¼‚ã€‚

FaaS

åŠŸèƒ½å³æœåŠ¡ (FaaS) æ˜¯ä¸€ç±»äº‘è®¡ç®—æœåŠ¡ï¼Œå®ƒæä¾›äº†ä¸€ä¸ªå¹³å°ï¼Œå…è®¸å®¢æˆ·å¼€å‘ã€è¿è¡Œå’Œç®¡ç†åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºåŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œè€Œæ— éœ€æ„å»ºå’Œç»´æŠ¤é€šå¸¸ä¸å¼€å‘å’Œå¯åŠ¨åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºç›¸å…³çš„åŸºç¡€è®¾æ–½ã€‚æŒ‰ç…§æ­¤æ¨¡å‹æ„å»ºåº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºæ˜¯å®ç°â€œæ— æœåŠ¡å™¨â€æ¶æ„çš„ä¸€ç§æ–¹å¼ï¼Œé€šå¸¸ç”¨äºæ„å»ºå¾®æœåŠ¡åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºã€‚

DaaS

åœ¨è®¡ç®—é¢†åŸŸï¼Œæ•°æ®å³æœåŠ¡ï¼ˆData as a serviceï¼Œç®€ç§°DaaSï¼‰æ˜¯æŒ‡åœ¨çº¿æ•°æ®æœåŠ¡ï¼Œå¼€å‘è€…å°†å¼€å‘ç”¨çš„æ•°æ®ä¿å­˜åœ¨äº’è”ç½‘ä¸Šå¹¶éšæ—¶è®¿é—®ï¼Œè€Œæ— éœ€ä½¿ç”¨ä¿å­˜åœ¨æœ¬åœ°è®¡ç®—æœºä¸Šçš„æ•°æ®åº“ã€‚

item.title: JavaScript Series
item.description:
JavaScript ( JS ) æ˜¯ä¸€ç§å…·æœ‰ å‡½æ•°ä¼˜å…ˆ çš„è½»é‡çº§ï¼Œè§£é‡Šå‹æˆ–å³æ—¶ç¼–è¯‘å‹çš„ç¼–ç¨‹è¯­è¨€ã€‚JavaScript æ˜¯ä¸€ç§åŸºäº åŸå‹ç¼–ç¨‹ã€å¤šèŒƒå¼çš„åŠ¨æ€è„šæœ¬è¯­è¨€ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”æ”¯æŒé¢å‘å¯¹è±¡ã€å‘½ä»¤å¼å’Œå£°æ˜å¼ï¼ˆå¦‚å‡½æ•°å¼ç¼–ç¨‹ï¼‰é£æ ¼ã€‚

Weekly

  • JavaScript Weekly - A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects
  • Node Weekly - A free, onceâ€“weekly e-mail round-up of Node.js news and articles
  • React - A JavaScript library for building user interfaces
    • React Status - A weekly roundup of the latest React and React Native links and tutorials.
    • React Newsletter - Stay up to date on the latest React news, tutorials, resources, and more. Delivered every Tuesday, for free.
    • React Digest - React Digest is a weekly newsletter with the five most interesting stories in front-end React development âš›ï¸ ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’».
  • Vue - The Progressive JavaScript Framework
    • VueWeekly .dev - ğŸ‘‹ A free, weekly email digest of Vue.js news and articles.
    • Vue.js Developers Newsletter - The best Vue articles in your inbox, weekly

JavaScript

  • JavaScript for impatient programmers
  • What the f*ck JavaScript?
    • That JavaScript quiz you found on Reddit - JS is weird: A fun and tricky JavaScript quiz
  • The Modern JavaScript Tutorial - Modern JavaScript Tutorial: simple, but detailed explanations with examples and tasks, including: closures, document and events, object oriented programming and more.

TypeScript

  • The TypeScript Handbook
  • type-challenges - Collection of TypeScript type challenges with online judge

• Paul Graham

item.title: Web Development Guide
item.description:
Guide

  • Learn to Code â€” For Free â€” Coding Courses for Busy People - Learn to Code â€” For Free.
  • MDN Web Docs - The MDN Web Docs site provides information about Open Web technologies including HTML, CSS, and APIs for both Web sites and progressive web apps.
  • Web | Google Developers - Build the next generation of web experiences.
  • Web Development for Beginners - A Curriculum - 24 Lessons, 12 Weeks, Get Started as a Web Developer
  • The Modern JavaScript Tutorial - Modern JavaScript Tutorial: simple, but detailed explanations with examples and tasks, including: closures, document and events, object oriented programming and more.
  • Can I use... Support tables for HTML5, CSS3, etc - "Can I use" provides up-to-date browser support tables for support of front-end web technologies on desktop and mobile web browsers.
  • W3Schools Online Web Tutorials - Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
  • DEV Community ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’»ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» - A constructive and inclusive social network for software developers. With you every step of your journey.
  • Medium - Every idea needs a Medium.
  • Sitepoint - Stay at the cutting edge of tech
  • Fireship.io - Training and Consulting for App Developers | Full Courses, Video Lessons, Chat, and More.
  • Master the JavaScript Ecosystem - ui.dev - Comprehensive learning resources for mastering the JavaScript ecosystem.
  • React Training - React Corporate Workshops, Training, and Consulting.
  • awesome-lowcode - å›½å†…ä½ä»£ç å¹³å°ä»ä¸šè€…äº¤æµ
  • Spellbook of Modern Web Dev - A Big Picture, Thesaurus, and Taxonomy of Modern JavaScript Web Development
  • JavaScript Series
  • CSS Series

Frame

  • React - A JavaScript library for building user interfaces
    • Preact - âš›ï¸ Fast 3kB React alternative with the same modern API. Components & Virtual DOM.
  • Vue.js - The Progressive JavaScript Framework
    • petite-vue - 5kb subset of Vue optimized for progressive enhancement
  • Angular - The modern web developer's platform
  • Svelte - Cybernetically enhanced web apps
  • Solid - Solid is a purely reactive library. It was designed from the ground up with a reactive core. It's influenced by reactive principles developed by previous libraries.
  • Lit - Simple. Fast. Web Components.

UI

React

  • Material-UI - Material-UI is a simple and customizable component library to build faster, beautiful, and more accessible React applications. Follow your own design system, or start with Material Design.
  • Ant Design - An enterprise-class UI design language and React UI library.
  • Chakra UI - âš¡ï¸ Simple, Modular & Accessible UI Components for your React Applications

Vue

  • Vuetify - ğŸ‰ Material Component Framework for Vue
  • Vant - Lightweight Mobile UI Components built on Vue

Surveys

  • W3Techs - extensive and reliable web technology surveys - W3Techs provides information about the usage of various types of technologies on the web.

Blog

  • 2ality â€“ JavaScript and more
  • Front-end Web Development, Chewed Up â† Alligator.io - Learn Angular 2+, Vue.js, React, TypeScript, Ionic, JavaScript (ES6/ES2015+) & CSS with short, straightforward posts.
  • Overreacted - Personal blog by Dan Abramov. I explain with words and code.
  • RWieruch - Software Engineer for React.js, Node.js, GraphQL and JavaScript. Based in Berlin, German/English speaking. Consulting/Freelancing for Web Development project: Code Audits/Reviews, Workshops, Training, Implementation ...
  • Dave Ceddia - Articles to help you learn and master frontend development with React.
  • Charlie Gerard | Senior frontend developer & Creative Technologist - Collection of side projects, conference talks and blog posts experimenting with frontend technologies and human-computer interaction.
  • Lea Verou â€“ Life at the bleeding edge (of web standards)
  • Blog - Chris Coyier

item.title: WebAssembly Series
item.description:
Guide

  • MDN WebAssembly
  • webassembly.org - WebAssembly (abbreviated Wasm) is a binary instruction format for a stack-based virtual machine. Wasm is designed as a portable compilation target for programming languages, enabling deployment on the web for client and server applications.
  • Rust ğŸ¦€ and WebAssembly ğŸ•¸ - This small book describes how to use Rust and WebAssembly together.
  • Awesome WebAssembly Languages - ğŸ˜ A curated list of languages that compile directly to or have their VMs in WebAssembly
  • WebAssembly Weekly - A weekly newsletter for keeping on top of what's new in the world of WebAssembly, with tutorials, examples, articles, and more.
  • Awesome Wasm - ğŸ˜ Curated list of awesome things regarding WebAssembly (wasm) ecosystem.
  • Wasm By Example - A hands-on introduction into WebAssembly ( Wasm ). Containing simple wasm examples and wasm tutorials on how to implement concepts and various tasks using WebAssembly.

WASI & VM & VDOM

  • wasmtime - Standalone JIT-style runtime for WebAssembly, using Cranelift
  • Wasm3 - ğŸš€ The fastest WebAssembly interpreter, and the most universal runtime
  • Wasmer - ğŸš€ The leading WebAssembly Runtime supporting WASI and Emscripten.
  • Lucet - Lucet, the Sandboxing WebAssembly Compiler.
  • WasmEdge - WasmEdge Runtime is a high-performance, extensible, and hardware optimized WebAssembly Virtual Machine for automotive, cloud, AI, and blockchain applications.
  • asm-dom - A minimal WebAssembly virtual DOM to build C++ SPA (Single page applications)

Tools

  • wapm - WAPM is the WebAssembly Package Manager.
  • trunk - Build, bundle & ship your Rust WASM application to the web.
  • wasm-tools - Rust tooling for low-level manipulation of WebAssembly modules.
  • wasm-pack - ğŸ“¦ âœ¨ your favorite rust -> wasm workflow tool!

Optimizing

  • Shrinking .wasm Code Size
    • Binaryen - Binaryen is a compiler and toolchain infrastructure library for WebAssembly, written in C++. It aims to make compiling to WebAssembly easy, fast, and effective.
    • Twiggy - Twiggy ğŸŒ± is a code size profiler
  • Optimizing Code (cpp)
  • Superoptimization of WebAssembly Bytecode

Open Source

  • vite-plugin-rsw - ğŸ¦€ wasm-pack plugin for Vite
  • rsw-node - âšªï¸ wasm-pack build executed in remote deployment
  • wasi-fs-access - This is a demo shell powered by WebAssembly, WASI, Asyncify and File System Access API.
  • FFMPEG.WASM - ffmpeg.wasm is a pure WebAssembly / JavaScript port of FFmpeg. It enables video & audio record, convert and stream right inside browsers.
  • wasm-rust-chip8 - A WebAssembly CHIP-8 emulator written with Rust
  • NoteCalc - is a handy notepad with a smart builtin calculator.
  • Kalker/kalk - is a calculator with math syntax that supports user-defined variables and functions, complex numbers, and estimation of derivatives and integrals
  • wasmboy - Game Boy / Game Boy Color Emulator Library, ğŸ® written for WebAssembly using AssemblyScript. ğŸš€ Demos built with Preact and Svelte. âš›ï¸
  • Plotters - A rust drawing library for high quality data plotting for both WASM and native, statically and realtimely ğŸ¦€ ğŸ“ˆ ğŸš€
  • redshirt - The redshirt operating system is an experiment to build some kind of operating-system-like environment where executables are all in Wasm and are loaded from an IPFS-like decentralized network.
  • Photon - âš¡ Rust/WebAssembly image processing library
  • markdown-wasm - Markdown parser and HTML generator implemented in WebAssembly, based on md4c.
  • hash-wasm - Hash-WASM is a âš¡ lightning fastâš¡ hash function library for browsers and Node.js. It is using hand-tuned WebAssembly binaries to calculate the hash faster than other libraries.
  • serde-wasm-bindgen - Native integration of Serde with wasm-bindgen
  • sycamore - A reactive DOM library for Rust in WASM.
  • gumnut - JS parser in Web Assembly / C.
  • box2d-wasm - Box2D physics engine compiled to WebAssembly. Supports TypeScript and ES modules.
  • TensorFlow.js - A WebGL accelerated JavaScript library for training and deploying ML models.

Article

  • WebAssemblyå…¥é—¨

  • Is WebAssembly magic performance pixie dust?
  • WebAssembly Actors: From Cloud to Edge - Embrace the actor model to build portable, secure, lightweight WebAssembly modules that thrive in the cloud, at the edge, and anywhere in between.
  • Learning WebAssembly Series - A series of learning texts covering the first steps with WebAssembly for complete beginners.
  • In-browser transcoding of video files with FFmpeg and WebAssembly

  • The WebAssembly App Gap
  • Why using WebAssembly and Rust together improves Node.js performance
  • [V8] WebAssembly compilation pipeline
  • Optimizing WebAssembly Startup Time
  • Bringing You Up to Speed on How Compiling WebAssembly is Faster
  • Maybe you don't need Rust and WASM to speed up your JS

item.title: JavaScript for impatient programmers (ES2021 edition)
item.description:
è¯»ä¹¦ç¬”è®°: åˆ›ä½œä¸æ˜“ï¼Œæ¨èè´­ä¹°ä½œè€…æ­£ç‰ˆä¹¦ç±ï¼ŒBuy the book

ç›®å½• (Table of contents)

I BACKGROUND

  1. Before you buy the book
  2. FAQ: book and supplementary material
  3. History and evolution of JavaScript
  4. New JavaScript features
  5. FAQ: JavaScript

IIâ€‚FIRST STEPS

  1. Using JavaScript: the big picture
  2. Syntax
  3. Consoles: interactive JavaScript command lines
  4. Assertion API
  5. Getting started with quizzes and exercises

IIIâ€‚VARIABLES AND VALUES

  1. Variables and assignment
  2. Values
  3. Operators

IVâ€‚PRIMITIVE VALUES

  1. The non-values undefined and null
  2. Booleans
  3. Numbers
  4. Math
  5. Bigints â€“ arbitrary-precision integers [ES2020] (advanced)
  6. Unicode â€“ a brief introduction (advanced)
  7. Strings
  8. Using template literals and tagged templates
  9. Symbols

Vâ€‚CONTROL FLOW AND DATA FLOW

  1. Control flow statements
  2. Exception handling
  3. Callable values
  4. Evaluating code dynamically: eval(), new Function() (advanced)

VIâ€‚MODULARITY

  1. Modules
  2. Single objects
  3. Prototype chains and classes

VIIâ€‚COLLECTIONS

  1. Synchronous iteration
  2. Arrays (Array)
  3. Typed Arrays: handling binary data (advanced)
  4. Maps (Map)
  5. WeakMaps (WeakMap) (advanced)
  6. Sets (Set)
  7. WeakSets (WeakSet) (advanced)
  8. Destructuring
  9. Synchronous generators (advanced)

VIIIâ€‚ASYNCHRONICITY

  1. Asynchronous programming in JavaScript
  2. Promises for asynchronous programming [ES6]
  3. Async functions
  4. Asynchronous iteration

IXâ€‚MORE STANDARD LIBRARY

  1. Regular expressions (RegExp)
  2. Dates (Date)
  3. Creating and parsing JSON (JSON)

Editor

  • Copilot - Your AI pair programmer. With GitHub Copilot, get suggestions for whole lines or entire functions right inside your editor.
  • CodeSandbox: Online Code Editor and IDE for Rapid Web Development - CodeSandbox is an online code editor and prototyping tool that makes creating and sharing web apps faster
  • CodePen - An online code editor, learning environment, and community for front-end web development using HTML, CSS and JavaScript code snippets, projects, and web applications.
  • Utopia - Utopia is a production-grade online coding and design tool for React that reads and writes code youâ€™ll want to commit.
  • JS Bin - Collaborative JavaScript Debugging - A live pastebin for HTML, CSS & JavaScript and a range of processors, including SCSS, CoffeeScript, Jade and more...
  • JSFiddle - Code Playground - Test your JavaScript, CSS, HTML or CoffeeScript online with JSFiddle code editor.
  • StackBlitz - The online code editor for web apps. Powered by Visual Studio Code.

Browser Cookie

  • EditThisCookie - EditThisCookie is the famous Google Chrome/Chromium extension for editing cookies

èƒŒæ™¯

ä½†å°±æˆ‘è‡ªèº«ç»å†åŠæ¥è§¦é¡¹ç›®è€Œè¨€ï¼Œé¡¹ç›®è¿˜æ˜¯åœç•™åœ¨å¦‚ä½•ç¼–å†™ç»„ä»¶çš„å±‚æ¬¡ä¸Šï¼Œç®€å•çš„å®ç°ä¸€äº›å¤ç”¨ã€‚ä¸€äº›å†å²é¡¹ç›®å› ä¸ºéœ€æ±‚çš„è¿­ä»£ï¼ŒåŠŸèƒ½åœ¨ä¸æ–­å¢åŠ ï¼Œå†™ä»£ç çš„äººå‘˜ä¹Ÿåœ¨ä¸æ–­æ›´æ›¿ï¼Œäº¤æ¥ã€‚å°±ä¼šå¯¼è‡´æœ€åçš„æ¥æ‰‹é¡¹ç›®çš„äººç—›è‹¦ä¸å ªï¼Œé‡æ„ï¼Ÿä¸ç°å®ï¼Œæ—¶é—´ä¸å¤Ÿï¼Œä¹‹å‰çš„éœ€æ±‚ä¹Ÿä¸æ¸…æ¥šã€‚ç»§ç»­ä¿æŒï¼Ÿå°±é¢ä¸´ç€æ€ä¹ˆå»åœ¨åŸé¡¹ç›®ä¹‹ä¸Šç»§ç»­è¿­ä»£ã€‚ è¿›é€€ä¸¤éš¾...

åœ¨ä¹‹å‰çš„éœ€æ±‚æ¯«ä¸çŸ¥æƒ…çš„æƒ…å†µä¸‹ï¼Œå¦‚ä½•å®Œæˆéœ€æ±‚åŠŸèƒ½çš„è¿­ä»£ï¼ŒUI æ”¹ç‰ˆï¼Ÿåªèƒ½é€šè¿‡å…¨å±€æœç´¢ä¸€äº›å…³é”®è¯ï¼Œå…³é”®å­—å»ä¸€æ­¥æ­¥å‘ä¸Š debug æºç ã€‚å¦‚æœä»£ç ä¸­ç‰µæ‰¯è¿‡å¤šçš„ä¸šåŠ¡é€»è¾‘ï¼Œå°±å®Œå…¨æ‡µé€¼äº†ï¼Œæ²¡äººçŸ¥é“ä¹‹å‰çš„éœ€æ±‚æ˜¯ä»€ä¹ˆ?_?!!!

ä»¥ React ä¸ºä¾‹ï¼Œå› ä¸ºæ¯ä¸ªäººéƒ½æœ‰è‡ªå·±å¯¹ç»„ä»¶çš„ç†è§£ï¼Œä¸åŒçš„äººç«™åœ¨ä¸åŒçš„ç»´åº¦å»å°è£…ï¼Œå°±å¯¼è‡´æœ€åçš„é¡¹ç›®ç»“æ„ï¼Œä»£ç ç»“æ„ä¹Ÿæ˜¯åƒå·®ä¸‡åˆ«ã€‚

  • æ— çŠ¶æ€ç»„ä»¶: ä¸æ¶‰åŠè¿‡å¤šçŠ¶æ€äº¤äº’ï¼Œå¾ˆå®¹æ˜“å®ç°ï¼Œå¤§å®¶çš„æ€è·¯éƒ½å·®ä¸å¤šã€‚
  • æœ‰çŠ¶æ€ç»„ä»¶: ä¸€æ—¦æ¶‰åŠåˆ°çŠ¶æ€ï¼Œä¸šåŠ¡é€»è¾‘ï¼Œäº¤äº’ã€‚ä¸€ä¸ªç»„ä»¶å°±å˜å¾—ä¸å†å¯æ§ã€‚æ¯ä¸ªäººçš„é£æ ¼ä¹Ÿéƒ½ä½“ç°çš„æ·‹æ¼“å°½è‡´ï¼
    • ç»„ä»¶å†…å‘èµ·è¯·æ±‚ï¼Œå„ç§è¯·æ±‚ï¼Œå¤§é‡æ¥å£ç›¸äº’ä¾èµ–ã€‚å¦‚æœæ¶‰åŠåˆ°å¤šä¸ªæ¥å£å¹¶è¡Œï¼Œåä¸€ä¸ªæ¥å£ä¾èµ–ä¸Šä¸€ä¸ªæ¥å£çš„è¿”å›å€¼ï¼Œå†™æ³•åˆæ˜¯å„æœ‰ç‰¹è‰²ã€‚
    • å‡ºç°å¤§é‡çš„ä¸šåŠ¡é€»è¾‘åˆ†æ”¯ï¼Œæ ¹æ®ä¸šåŠ¡ return å‡ºä¸åŒçš„ç»„ä»¶ â•¥ï¹â•¥
    • ç›´æ¥åœ¨ç»„ä»¶å†…å®ç°ä¸€ä¸ªæˆ–å¤šä¸ªå­ç»„ä»¶ (ãƒã¸ï¿£ã€)
    • å­ç»„ä»¶ä¸ŠæŒ‚è½½ç€å¤§é‡çš„ propsï¼Œå±æ€§æœ‰æ—¶å€™å¤šåˆ°ä»¤äººå‘æŒ‡ï¼Œæœ‰æ•°æ®ï¼Œæ–¹æ³•ï¼ŒçŠ¶æ€ï¼Œè‡ªå®šä¹‰çš„ xxxï¼Œå„ç§ä¼ é€’ã€‚ o(â•¥ï¹â•¥)o
    • æ¬¢è¿å¤§å®¶ç»§ç»­è¡¥å……åæ§½...

æ€è€ƒ

æˆ‘å¯¹æ•°æ®çš„ç†è§£ï¼Œå®ƒæ—¢è´´è¿‘äºä¸šåŠ¡å±‚ï¼Œä¹Ÿè€¦åˆç€äº¤äº’å±‚ï¼Œå¦‚æœä¸èƒ½å¾ˆå¥½çš„åˆ†ç¦»ç»„ç»‡è¿™ä¸‰å±‚ï¼Œå¾ˆå¯èƒ½ç‰µä¸€å‘è€ŒåŠ¨å…¨èº«ã€‚æ‰€ä»¥æ•°æ®æ˜¯æ ¸å¿ƒï¼Œæ—¢æ˜¯ä¸šåŠ¡çš„æ ¸å¿ƒï¼Œä¹Ÿæ˜¯ç»„ä»¶çš„æ ¸å¿ƒã€‚

  • æ•°æ®ï¼Œä¸šåŠ¡é€»è¾‘ï¼Œäº¤äº’éƒ½ä¼šå½±å“æœ€ç»ˆéœ€è¦æ¸²æŸ“çš„UIè§†å›¾ã€‚
  • ç¼–å†™ç»„ä»¶æ—¶ï¼Œé¦–å…ˆåˆ†æä¸šåŠ¡éœ€æ±‚ï¼Œå¯¹ç»„ä»¶è¿›è¡Œåˆ†å±‚ã€‚å¤§è‡´åˆ†ä¸ºæ•°æ® (DataSource)ï¼Œäº¤äº’ (Action)ï¼ŒUIè§†å›¾ (View)ä¸‰å±‚ã€‚
    • æ•°æ®å¤„ç† (Handle): æ‰¿è½½ç€æ ¸å¿ƒä¸šåŠ¡é€»è¾‘ï¼Œå¯¹æ•°æ®è¿›è¡Œæ ¼å¼åŒ–è¾“å‡ºï¼Œä¾› UI ç»„ä»¶è¿›è¡Œæ ‡å‡†åŒ–æ¥æ”¶ï¼Œä¸€èˆ¬ä»¥ function å½¢å¼å­˜åœ¨ã€‚
    • å‰¯ä½œç”¨ (Effect): ä»¥æˆ‘ç›®å‰æ¥è§¦åˆ°çš„åœºæ™¯ï¼Œä¸»è¦è¿˜æ˜¯ä»¥äº‹ä»¶ä¿®æ”¹ç»„ä»¶çŠ¶æ€ï¼Œæ›´æ–°æ•°æ®åŠUIè§†å›¾ä¸ºä¸»ã€‚æ‰€ä»¥äº‹ä»¶åŠçŠ¶æ€å˜æ›´å¯èƒ½ä¼šåŒæ—¶å‡ºç°åœ¨ æ•°æ®å¤„ç† å’Œ UI è§†å›¾ ä¸­ã€‚åœ¨æ•°æ®å¤„ç†ä¸­ï¼Œè°ƒç”¨ (Call) æ–¹æ³•ï¼›åœ¨ UI ä¸­ï¼Œç»‘å®š (Bind) äº‹ä»¶åŠçŠ¶æ€ã€‚UI å±‚å°½é‡ä¸ç›´æ¥å¤„ç†æˆ–å°‘å¤„ç†æºæ•°æ®ã€‚

ä¸¾ä¾‹

  • ä¸šåŠ¡ä¸­å¸¸ä¼šæœ‰è¿™æ ·ä¸€ç§éœ€æ±‚ï¼Œç”¨æˆ·å¯ä»¥åŠ¨æ€çš„æ–°å¢åˆ é™¤ä¸€ä¸ªåˆ—è¡¨ï¼Œå› ä¸ºæ¯æ¬¡éœ€è¦å¤„ç†çš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œå’Œå±•ç¤ºçš„ UI å½¢å¼éƒ½æ˜¯ä¸ç¡®å®šçš„ã€‚å¯èƒ½æˆ‘ä»¬æ¯æ¬¡åšéœ€æ±‚æ—¶éƒ½å®ç°ä¸€æ¬¡ä»£ç ï¼Œæˆ–è€…æŠŠæ–°å¢å’Œåˆ é™¤æ–¹æ³•æå–å‡ºæ¥ï¼Œå®ç°éƒ¨åˆ†å¤ç”¨ã€‚ä»¥ React Hook ä¸ºä¾‹ï¼š
/* hooks/useDataOP.js */
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import { v4 as uuidv4 } from 'uuid';
import cloneDeep from 'lodash/cloneDeep';

// ä½¿ç”¨Symbolä½œä¸ºæ•°æ®çš„å”¯ä¸€key
const safeKey = Symbol('tid');

// æ ¼å¼åŒ–æºæ•°æ®
const opFmtData = (data) => {
  return cloneDeep(data).map((i) => {
    i[safeKey] = uuidv4();
    return i;
  });
};

/**
 * useDataOP
 * @author lencx
 * @param rawData - æºæ•°æ®
 */
export default function useDataOP(rawData = []) {
  const [opData, setData] = useState([]);
  const [opType, setType] = useState(null);
  const [isOk, setOk] = useState(true);

  // æ•°æ®åˆå§‹åŒ–
  useEffect(() => {
    if (Array.isArray(rawData)) {
      if (rawData.length > 0) {
        const data = opFmtData(rawData);
        setData(data);
      }
      setOk(true);
    } else {
      setOk(false);
    }
    // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/exhaustive-deps
  }, []);

  if (!isOk) return console.error('Parameter must be an array!');

  /**
   * æ–°å¢
   * @param data - æ–°å¢çš„æ•°æ®å¯¹è±¡
   */
  const opAdd = (data = {}) => {
    const result = [...opData, { [safeKey]: uuidv4(), ...data }];
    setData(result);
    setType('add');
    return result;
  };

  /**
   * åˆ é™¤
   * @param value - éœ€è¦åˆ é™¤çš„å€¼ï¼Œå¦‚æœä¸ºå­—ç¬¦ä¸²æˆ–æ•°å­—æ—¶ï¼Œéœ€è¦é…åˆkeyä½¿ç”¨ã€‚
   *   å¦‚æœvalueä¸ºå¯¹è±¡ï¼Œåˆ™ä¸ºéœ€è¦åˆ é™¤çš„è®°å½•ï¼Œé€šè¿‡safeKeyæŸ¥æ‰¾åˆ é™¤ã€‚
   * @param key - é»˜è®¤ä¸ºidï¼Œé€‰å¡«ï¼Œå¯çœç•¥
   */
  const opRemove = (value, key = 'id') => {
    let result;
    if (typeof value === 'string' || typeof value === 'number') {
      result = opData.filter((i) => i[key] !== value);
    } else {
      result = opData.filter((i) => i[safeKey] !== value[safeKey]);
    }
    setData(result);
    setType('remove');
    return result;
  };

  /**
   * æ’åº
   * @param startIndex - å½“å‰ä½ç½®
   * @param endIndex - ç›®æ ‡ä½ç½®
   */
  const opReorder = (startIndex, endIndex) => {
    const result = Array.from(opData);
    const [removed] = result.splice(startIndex, 1);
    result.splice(endIndex, 0, removed);
    setData(result);
    setType('reorder');
    return result;
  };

  return {
    opData,
    opType,
    opAdd,
    opRemove,
    opReorder,
    opRawData: rawData,
    opSafeKey: safeKey,
  };
}
// ä½¿ç”¨useDataOP
import React, { useState } from 'react';
import useDataOP from '@/hooks/useDataOP';

export default () => {
  const { opData, opAdd, opRemove, opReorder, opSafeKey } = useDataOP([]);
  const [count, setCount] = useState(1);

  const handleAdd = () => {
    setCount(count+1);
    opAdd({ name: `test${count}` });
  }
  return (
    <div>
      <button onClick={handleAdd}>Add</button>
      {opData.map((i, idx) => {
        return (
          <div key={i[opSafeKey]}>
            <span>Name: {i.name}</span>
            {' '}
            <button onClick={() => opRemove(i)}>Remove</button>
            <button onClick={() => opReorder(idx, idx-1)}>Up+1</button>
            <button onClick={() => opReorder(idx, idx+1)}>Down-1</button>
          </div>
        )
      })}
    </div>
  );
}

æ€»ç»“

æ•°æ®ä¸ UI çš„è§£è€¦ï¼Œå…¶å®å°±æ„å‘³ç€ä¸šåŠ¡é€»è¾‘ä¸ UI ç»„ä»¶è§†å›¾çš„è§£è€¦ã€‚å½“ç»„ä»¶è¦è·¨å¹³å°ï¼Œæˆ–è€… UI å¤§æ¢è‚¤æ—¶ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬åªéœ€è¦å®ç°æ ‡å‡†çš„æ•°æ®æ¥æ”¶ç»„ä»¶å°±å¯ä»¥äº†ã€‚ä¸šåŠ¡åŠŸèƒ½å¯¹åº”çš„å…¶å®å°±æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªä¸ªæ•°æ®å¤„ç†å‡½æ•°å’Œ UI ç»„ä»¶çš„ç»„åˆï¼Œé€šè¿‡äº‹ä»¶å»è§¦å‘æˆ–è€…ç»‘å®šä¸€äº›çŠ¶æ€ã€‚å½“æ•°æ®å¤„ç†æˆ–ç»„ä»¶ä¸æ»¡è¶³éœ€æ±‚çš„æ—¶å€™ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬åªéœ€è¦å»æ‰©å±•å¯¹åº”çš„å‡½æ•°æˆ–ç»„ä»¶ã€‚
